issues.title: Elements must meet minimum color contrast ratio thresholds
issues.description: Ensure the contrast between foreground and background colors meets WCAG 2 AA minimum contrast ratio thresholds

any.message: Element has insufficient color contrast of 2.84 (foreground color: #999999, background color: #ffffff, font size: 10.8pt (14.4px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

nodes.failureSummary:

issues.title: Background and foreground colors do not have a sufficient contrast ratio.
issues.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. [Learn how to provide sufficient color contrast](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/color-contrast).

automatic.name: Headings; Wrong Order, Empty & Missing Headings;

issues.title: Heading levels should only increase by one
issues.description: Ensure the order of headings is semantically correct

nodes.failureSummary:

  Heading order invalid

issues.title: Heading elements are not in a sequentially-descending order
issues.description: Properly ordered headings that do not skip levels convey the semantic structure of the page, making it easier to navigate and understand when using assistive technologies. [Learn more about heading order](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/heading-order).

node.explanation:

nodes.html: A blockchain node is a computer or device running the network's software and interacting with other nodes to verify data added to the blockchain. Operating this software across multiple devices boosts the network's security and strengthens its decentralization.

nodes.html: The primary functions of a blockchain node are to broadcast and validate transactions. When a user submits a transaction, it's picked up by one node, which then shares it with all other nodes across the network.

nodes.html: After all nodes read the transaction and confirm that the user has sufficient funds, they approve the transaction to proceed. Because every node takes part in verifying transactions, a transaction can only be canceled or denied if 51% of the nodes agree that it's invalid.

nodes.html: After a node validates new transactions, they are bundled into blocks and added to the blockchain according to the network's established rules. Once added, no node can alter the contents of any block, ensuring that the recorded data remains permanent and unchangeable.

automatic.name: Size; Target Size; Element too small

issues.title: Touch targets do not have sufficient size or spacing.
issues.description: Touch targets with sufficient size and spacing help users who may have difficulty targeting small controls to activate the targets. [Learn more about touch targets](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/target-size).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Target has insufficient size (372px by 18.5px, should be at least 24px by 24px)
  Target has insufficient space to its closest neighbors. Safe clickable space has a diameter of 23px instead of at least 24px.
